intro: Astragalus fraxinifolius, commonly known as the ash-leaf milkvetch, is a perennial legume native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It is characterized by its compound leaves that resemble the shape of ash tree leaves, hence its common name. The plant produces yellow flowers in clusters, typically blooming in the summer months. It thrives in rocky and arid environments, showcasing its adaptability to harsh conditions. Astragalus fraxinifolius is also valued for its ecological role in stabilizing soil and supporting pollinator populations.
